intro: Heracleum protheiforme var. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved cowparni, is a perennial herb native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its hollow stems and aromatic foliage. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks.
